decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through a combination of counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Orcish Bowmasters. With access to powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk, as well as efficient mana acceleration from cards like Black Lotus and Mox Jet, it aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The addition of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and resilience to the deck's game plan.

The deck aims to quickly disrupt the opponent's mana base and lock down their resources while ramping up its own through powerful artifact mana sources. It utilizes cards like Mishra's Workshop, Sol Ring, and Mana Crypt to power out threats like Lodestone Golem and Nettlecyst while also employing disruptive elements such as Null Rod and Sphere of Resistance to slow down the opponent's game plan. The deck can also generate card advantage with cards like Mystic Forge and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim, allowing it to maintain pressure while controlling the board.

The main idea behind this deck is to disrupt and slow down your opponent with hate cards like Archon of Emeria, Chancellor of the Annex, and Void Mirror, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Witch Enchanter. Using disruptive lands like Wasteland and Ancient Tomb, as well as protection from counterspells with Cavern of Souls, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while presenting a quick clock to close out the game. Additionally, the deck includes powerful removal like Swords to Plowshares and ways to generate card advantage with Seasoned Dungeoneer and Vexing Bauble.

The main goal of this deck is to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up the combo of Oath of Druids with Atraxa, Grand Unifier or other powerful creatures. This deck focuses on cheating creatures into play quickly and efficiently while using counterspells and disruption to protect the combo. By using cards like Show and Tell and Forbidden Orchard, the deck can quickly get the Oath of Druids trigger and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures. The deck also includes additional control elements like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing various control elements like counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually building card advantage and controlling the board. It also includes powerful draw spells to maintain consistency and access necessary resources. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional utility and value by allowing the player to recast low-cost permanents from their graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through efficient resource management and strategic decision-making.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources and disrupting their game plan while generating card advantage and setting up powerful combos with cards like Gifts Ungiven, Underworld Breach, and Brain Freeze. Key cards like Force of Will, Mana Drain, and Flusterstorm help protect the player's own game plan while slowing down the opponent. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing for the recursion of key cards from the graveyard. Ultimately, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through careful resource management and strategic plays.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategies by playing powerful hate cards like Chancellor of the Annex, Archon of Emeria, and Void Mirror while deploying aggressive threats like White Plume Adventurer and Witch Enchanter to quickly close out the game. The deck also utilizes powerful mana acceleration from cards like Ancient Tomb, Chrome Mox, and Moxen to deploy its threats ahead of curve. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures to secure a victory in a fast-paced format like Vintage 1 vs 1.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures to put pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their strategy with hate cards like Archon of Emeria, Chancellor of the Annex, and Void Mirror. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's plays with cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere, while also ramping up with fast mana sources like Moxen and Ancient Tomb. With a mix of disruptive creatures and powerful artifacts, the deck aims to control the game and prevent the opponent from executing their game plan effectively.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents with hatebears like Anointed Peacekeeper and Archon of Emeria, while also applying aggressive pressure with creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Clarion Conqueror. It utilizes powerful mana acceleration from Moxen and lands like Ancient Tomb to cast its threats quickly. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Void Mirror to control the game. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while putting pressure on them to win quickly.

The deck utilizes Oath of Druids to quickly bring powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield, while controlling the game with counterspells and disruptive spells like Thoughtseize. It also includes cards like Show and Tell and Flash to cheat out big threats. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and disrupt their game plan, ultimately gaining control of the game and securing a win.

The deck focuses on utilizing hatebears, such as Archon of Emeria and Anointed Peacekeeper, to disrupt opponents while applying aggressive pressure with creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Clarion Conqueror. It also includes disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Void Mirror to control the game. The fast mana acceleration provided by the Moxen and other ramp spells allows for early drops and powerful plays, supported by a mana denial strategy with cards like Wasteland. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of disruption and aggression to secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy by utilizing hatebears like Anointed Peacekeeper, Archon of Emeria, and Chancellor of the Annex. These creatures hinder the opponent's ability to cast spells and interact with the board effectively. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Clarion Conqueror, Seasoned Dungeoneer, and Void Mirror to further impede the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck contains powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and the Moxes to ramp into its threats quickly. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal, and hand disruption. By controlling the board using cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine, as well as countering threats with Force of Will and Mana Drain, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent. With cards like Dig Through Time and Treasure Cruise for card advantage, along with a selection of powerful threats like Psychic Frog and Orcish Bowmasters, this deck seeks to control the game tempo and grind out a win.

This deck focuses on utilizing the powerful graveyard interaction of Underworld Breach and Gifts Ungiven to control the game. By using Gifts Ungiven to search for key cards like Time Walk, Tolarian Academy, and other combo pieces, the deck can quickly assemble a game-winning combo. It also includes a range of powerful counterspells and tutors to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds an extra layer of recursion and value to ensure the deck can grind out wins in longer games.

The main focus of this deck is to generate mana quickly and efficiently using the artifact cards and lands included. It aims to play aggressively by putting pressure on the opponent with powerful creatures like Lodestone Golem, Stonecoil Serpent, and Glaring Fleshraker. The deck also has disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Pithing Needle to control the opponent's plays. With cards like Mystic Forge and Karn, the Great Creator, the deck can generate card advantage and access powerful artifacts to further push its advantage.

This Vintage Doomsday combo deck focuses on fast and efficient card selection and manipulation to set up for a game-winning Thassa's Oracle finish. Using cards like Ancestral Recall, Brainstorm, and Ponder to dig through the deck quickly, the goal is to assemble the necessary pieces and cast Doomsday to put Thassa's Oracle on top of the library. With Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, this deck is capable of winning the game in a single turn with the right combination of cards and sequencing.
